website_summaries.verdict: This stimulating food tree is a top choice for cats who could do with a little extra mental stimulation or exercise. Forces lazy kitties to work for their meals.
pros: Multi-layered vertical design encourages physical activity and slows eating
Openings are large enough for big paws
Variable difficulty settings can be adjusted to suit individual personalities
cons: Take-charge cats might simply knock it over to access food

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be more sturdy...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this product, but my kitten does not actually paw at the food. He grabs the green part with his mouth, pulls, and lets go, causing it to ricochet, spraying cat food EVERYWHERE. He's only 4 pounds right now, and I have a feeling when he gets a little bigger, he will be pulling it down completely.
customer_reviews.author: Mila O.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: My fat, lazy cat hates this thing. I love it. She hates it because she can't gobble her food down as fast as possible and she has to work to get the food. I love it because she can't gobble her food down and cry for more. She is actually eating a little less since she is to lazy to keep at it too long. Thanks Catit.
customer_reviews.author: BEATRICE ANDERSON

customer_reviews.title: At first the cat didn't like it but now she gets it
customer_reviews.text: At first the cat didn't like it but now she gets it. Wish I had it last year when she was eating too quickly and throwing up! The only downside is it can be noisy as she knocks that food down... late night or early morning feedings can wake me up in the next room....
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: We're very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: We got the Catit Senses 2.0 Food Tree for one of our cats, and he loves it. He's a big guy -- weighs about 16 lbs -- but he doesn't topple it over. He just pokes around in it to get the food out. We're very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Itchy Paws!
customer_reviews.text: My cat got used to this after a while, and then a while after that, developed very itchy paws. Since he basically would have to paw out the food every time and then clean his paws, it was beginning to irritate his paw pads to the point that he was chewing on them. Since then I've stopped using this and he's back to normal grooming practices, paws included. Concept was a nice idea but in the end, I'll need to stick with a feeder with less contact. Wish I could refund this, as it hasn't even been a year, but it doesn't look like Amazon gives the option anymore.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: but she's having fun! It doesn't come with instructions
customer_reviews.text: The first few days, my cat didn't care at all about this thing, but then she got curious about it. It's taking her a little time to figure it out, but she's having fun! It doesn't come with instructions, per se, but it's pretty easy to figure out how it gets put together. Look in the second level for the "1", "2", and "3" levels of difficulty. In the video I've attached, I've removed the very top level for now, just to make it easier for her to figure out. Once she's got it down, I'll add the top level back.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Handelman

customer_reviews.title: Pet treat tree
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, due to rough/sharp edges on the edges where they put their paws, my cats paws got cut
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Marie Kruse

customer_reviews.title: Rethink the food tree and buy the food digger!
customer_reviews.text: The Catit Senses 2.0 Food Tree arrived in excellent condition, especially for purchasing it used. I really thought my 4 cats would enjoy this based upon the fact they love kitty treats and mazes. Unfortunately, they weren't interested. I can't return the item, but I definitely wanted to put in my two cents worth. Our cats were more than able to use it based off the instructions, but they were bored with the fact that all they had to do was reach in and grab it out. The Catit 2.0 food digger was the real pot of gold for them. I highly recommend purchasing this other food toy instead.
customer_reviews.author: D. Caron

customer_reviews.title: Not a pinata
customer_reviews.text: My cat seemed to think this item was a pinata, and after one day of shoving his paw inside to only get a few pieces of kibble at a time, broke the receptacle off the base and chowed down on the spoils. He's a weird and powerful cat, if you are blessed with a "normal" cat, this item would work.
customer_reviews.author: Aldne Now

customer_reviews.title: It’s the solution for gluttony
customer_reviews.text: Finally a solution to fast eaters/quick vomiters. The food tree slows down my cat and so far resists his attacks out of frustration. It is just sturdy but not quite enough. He’s stumbled upon a few “tricks” for getting pellets out without trickling them down the tree, or for getting the ones that get stuck on the edges or crevices, but that slows him down too. I hooked the tree up to a regular food dispenser that releases several very small doses per day (see photo). That helps with limiting the calorie intake and keeps the cat satisfied. It also will allow us to keep using the tree all day after Covid when we are outside the house at work.
customer_reviews.author: raul

customer_reviews.title: Chubby cat lost weight
customer_reviews.text: Got my fat cat to lose weight, which was my goal. And it really reset her appetite. She's running around and playing again. But my younger cat had too much fun with it. He began to eat way more than before and he manhandled it so much that it broke. One of the tabs that holds the tower onto the base broke off. No way to fix it. Also, I didn't realize you could register it at the manufacturer with a unique product code in the package. I recycled the box and now that it's broken, I have no way to register it to get the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Great for overweight or cats that eat to fast.
customer_reviews.text: My older cat hates it! Which is perfect :-) She had become dangerously overweight and unfortunately due to our lifestyle set meals was not an option. She has no problem using it but it slows her down and she's no longer gorges herself. She has lost weight and I can tell she's much happier now. We got a kitten and he LOVES it. It is a game to him. It also came in a cute box that my daughter had fun coloring and both the cats love!
customer_reviews.author: Claven

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my mischievous food motivated cat
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended that we get our cat an interactive feeder to keep our cat busy and from eating so fast. We decided on this product and it’s been great. It takes several hours for our cat to eat all his food. It makes him work for his food. The only downside is that our small dog (6 pound Yorkie) can stick her face in the holes and steal food but other than that, works great. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: My former barn cat said “Nope”
customer_reviews.text: I saw this at my vet’s office. Their house cat uses it all the time. I bought one for my outdoor-turned-indoor cat who eats her dry food very fast. I thought she would find it stimulating since she used to be a barn cat and had to work for her food (mice, etc). I could not get her to eat from this feeder, no matter what I tried. I put her food in and tried “wait and see” and also used my fingers to show her how it falls out. She will not eat from any of the openings. She will only eat from the base. Also, feel it is difficult to clean to green portion of the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Bought other Catit products and loved the concept and quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought other Catit products and loved the concept and quality. Lots of fun for the kitties and us. This was bought as an addition to the other stuff we have. I was worried the kitties would not get the food the first night but they are very smart and were able to get the kibbles from the food tree (I know as there were a lot more bits in the white receptacle the next morning!!). Makes them my little tigers!!
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: cat food fall right through it to the bottom
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe food falls right thru to the bottom of this feeder. Also it has huge holes on the top level where all the food falls out so you can only put a tiny bit of food in the thing. Ridiculous and poorly designed product and I'm in the cat business for 30 years.
customer_reviews.author: marie p.

customer_reviews.title: Best feeder ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing ever. My cat was way over weight. No matter what we did he would find things to eat even the dogs food. We can now put his food in this and instead of eating it all in one sitting, he has to fish for it and soon gets tired of it and walks away. He goes back to it throughout the day and eats a little more. Bottom line my cat has lost weight! My only wish is that it was weighted down because a cat can flip it in spite of the very large base. All in all a great value and a success in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn M

customer_reviews.title: No stars if I could.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but lots of the food bounces out and scatters. Followup: I changed the rating to one start because I can't have no stars. It lasted about 2 months. One of our cats was trying to rake out some food and the green housing broke off the base and fell on him. It's just held on with 3 little tabs that "lock" in to the base. Very week design. Waste of $20. Save your money for something better. Too late now to return it :(
customer_reviews.author: RoverMan

customer_reviews.title: Love Catit!
customer_reviews.text: So glad that I purchased this item. Our 12 week old kitten would flick his food out of the dish and onto the mat or the floor. Glad that it has a large base because he has jumped on top to get to the kibble. He can still flick the kibble onto the floor but he now pounces and typically eats the piece right away.This provides the sensory input that he was craving.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something that would help slow down my cats eating but also get in some exercise since he is a little bit chunky . It has been a bit of a challenge to get my old guy to exercise but this bowl has helped us out tremendously. Just like any chunky cat, he didnt like it at first because he actually had to work for his food but after a couple of feedings, he figured out how to get his food and I couldn't be any happier with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: NO MORE SCARF'N'BARF
customer_reviews.text: I was worried my cat wouldn't use this; when we first got it, it took DAYS before she WOULD use it. I thought maybe she wasn't smart enough, but no, she's just kind of lazy. :) That being said, this is AWESOME at preventing the dreaded scarf'n'barf behavior - we do this instead of free feeding, and it's cut down on the amount she eats, such that she's only eating when she's hungry and she's eating more slowly. We used to have a scarf'n'barf at LEAST once a day; it has happened once in total since we got the food tree, and that time only because too many kibbles fell when I was adding food to it.
customer_reviews.author: Dyna

customer_reviews.title: Not for me, cat turned into a pig and made a huge mess
customer_reviews.text: All was fine at first... but then my cat started chewing her food up and leaving pebbles all around the tree. She didn't eat over the dish anymore so I was constantly sweeping up most of her uneaten food and stepping on these bits. Wasteful and dirty kitty, what to do? So after only three months of use I've switched out to an auto feeder and she's eating over the bowl once again. I can't say this tree won't work for your cat, only that it didn't work for mine. Cat diets are tough! Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Obremski

customer_reviews.title: Almost there with the design
customer_reviews.text: They’ve updated the design from the previous release. However, I’m still having issues filling the cat food without it all falling out from each of the platforms. So I feed the cats it falls down then I have to scoop it up and put it back on top and then it falls down I scoop it back up. You see how this will get a little annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Coolsaya

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but cat quickly figured out a work-around
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes the toy and we use it for her dry food. I will say, however, that she very quickly learned that if she bashes her head against it, more of the kibbles will fall out faster. We own a Ripple Rug, so we've stuck it in one of the rug holes to tether the base down and that seems like a good fix. Overall, it's a good product for its price.
customer_reviews.author: fxc

customer_reviews.title: Scattered kibbles
customer_reviews.text: We've used this feeder for about 7 months. One cat will fish out kibbles and the other will have nothing to do with it. It's worked well overall but my main problem with it is that kibbles get scattered in about a 3 ft. circle around the feeder when they are dropped down into the bottom section. My snooty cats won't pick up the stray kibbles so it always looks messy. We've gone back to using a stainless bowl since this feeder hasn't stopped the gorging and barfing when the mood strikes them.
customer_reviews.author: Robins

customer_reviews.title: Works great for multiple cats!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I have 3 kitties: Enya, 12 yrs old, a gobbler, diagnosed with serious case of "fat cat". Turner Trouble, big tuxedo kitty, eats 3-4 chunks a day. Calvin, half grown orange tabby, all day nibbler. Problem: feed all 3, Calvin and Turner leave some for later... Enya eats all hers and the rest of theirs! These feeders have solved the problem because Enya is just lazy enough that she only works for "enough". They all come back throughout the day. In the evening, I use three of the "snack" balls for 2nd half of their daily food alliwance. Enya won't bother with them. She's finally slimming down an Calvin is getting sufficient nutrition for an active growing kitten!
customer_reviews.author: GINGER L. LINKEL

customer_reviews.title: Hey, it worked!
customer_reviews.text: So I had a weird problem. One of my cats preferred to dine whilst lying on one side like a Roman senator. He would scoop up a handful of food in one paw, eat a single piece, then negligently cast aside the rest of the scoop. Let's just say that the ants appreciated his largesse, even if I didn't. God, the ridiculous mess. It's been about two weeks, and though I occasionally find that they've dragged the feeder to odd places, it seems like both of my beasts really enjoy their new tower of food... and both the mess and the ants have stayed gone.
customer_reviews.author: A purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable: Cat broke after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: My cat (who is not usually very clever, but is a big boy--18lbs) decided recently not to put his paws in the slots to get the food, but instead to put a paw on top and shake the whole tower so food flings everywhere. The tower shattered at the connection to the base (see picture) and an email to catit's customer service was met with "we're sorry but we can't replace the tower piece." I have and love several other catit items, but I am deeply disappointed not only in this product but also catit's customer service.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sarten

customer_reviews.title: cats are afraid of it will not try to get food
customer_reviews.text: I have two overweight kitties and thought this would be great. They will not attempt to pull food out of the tiers. When I try to show them how to do it and a few pieces drop into the plastic tray around the bottom, the sound of the food hitting the plastic scares them and they run out of the room. I've tried jiggling a little out and leaving it for a day or so, they will eat whats down in the tray but will not attempt to get more. Unfortunately, the only thing of use was the cardboard box it came in which they are enjoying playing in. Quite an expensive cardboard box but oh well.
customer_reviews.author: nysbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great cat entertainment and slows down their eating. My cat figured out how to use it immediately. She has pulled it completely over several times, but she is a large cat and sometimes gets her claw stuck. She has also moved it by pulling the bottom edge with her teeth to get a piece of food that overshot the tray and was next to the edge. Taking it apart to wash it is rather tricky, so be sure to observe how it's put together before you take it apart! The top has come loose from the bottom section on several occasions, but is easily put back on. Overall, I'm very pleased with this device and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: tonytiger7

customer_reviews.title: Another smash hit from Catit!
customer_reviews.text: This tree really gets our cat thinking, and it's exactly what we needed. Catit has yet to disappoint with their puzzles, we have the scoop cup kind and Curry loves that one as well. Couldn't recommend this enough!
customer_reviews.author: Athena

customer_reviews.title: Does pretty much everything I wanted it to do.
customer_reviews.text: I love the box it came in, so cute. One of my cats couldn't figure out how to get at the food at first but he eventually got the hang of it. There's always some kibble that remains in the middle, no matter how long I try to get them to fish it out so I give the container a good shaking out every now and then. Overall it works good. Keeps them from overeating, eating too fast, and keeps them nice and occupied while I'm at work.
customer_reviews.author: crystal groves

customer_reviews.title: Day one 2 yr old Polydactyl cat tore off rubber ...
customer_reviews.text: Day one 2 yr old Polydactyl cat tore off rubber gasket under the base of the feeder---so she could scoot it around the floor. However I was impressed she was not able to tip it over. Feeder was empty so she either shook it until it dispensed food or she figured out how to move the food around so it would drip down. Plan to replace the gasket with something else to keep it from moving around the flood. Will update as the days go on. P.S. she does have another cat as an accomplice.
customer_reviews.author: hsms

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this because the Vet suggested a slow feeder as our cats needed to lose weight. After researching for a while, we selected this interactive feeder. It took one cat just one day to learn how to feed herself. The other cat stubbornly took five days of watching her sister enjoy food. Now two months later they are actively using this regularly for all of their meals and have skimmed down easily. HIGHLY recommend this product! It’s sturdy and easy to assemble & clean. AAA+++
customer_reviews.author: AGR

customer_reviews.title: Maybe we just didn't pick the right model but very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I regret this purchase for 3 main reasons. First, it's very messy as the food doesn't stay within the center circle but cascades all over the floor. Second, my cats aren't really getting it and so they just are needy. Third, the feeder is flimsy and parts of it have started coming off already (only had it for two weeks). Maybe we just didn't pick the right model but very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Haney

customer_reviews.title: Its fun watching the cat use the tree!
customer_reviews.text: I got this feeder for my parents new cat, Moka. Initially my parents were skeptical and didn't bother forcing him to use the feeder, instead feeding him out of a bowl. He quickly gained several pounds and I asked them to try the feeder at least for a couple days. It took him about a day or two to completely figure out how to use it (and yes, you will need to withhold feeding your cat until they figure out how to get the food out), but once he did they haven't gone back to bowl feeding since and they love watching him use the food tree! I would recommend this feeder to all cat owners!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: I must have dumb cats
customer_reviews.text: I already had a cat feeder designed to slow them down. This worked, but my very overweight cat would lay on it's side and scoop out one kibble at a time and eat it. It is willing to do that all day long. I got this thing so it would at least be forced to stand while it was eating. Neither of my cats have figured it out. So, the fat cat is losing weight, which is good, but the lean cat is also losing weight, which isn't good. Will give it another week or two, but I think I am going to have to bail on this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chubby monster broke it in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: It worked well enough for a little while so the chubby gremlin would stop scarfing all of his food and the yacking it up all over the carpet. The food monster was not quite bright enough to use it properly, so mainly got food out by headbutting it hard enough for kibbles to fall out. He would also just paw the whole tower waiting for it to fall back into place while flinging the kibbles all over, which eventually lead to the breaking of the tower. Will need to find a replacement bowl as this clearly did not do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: MY THREE CATS LOVE THIS TROUBLE PREVENTER! HAHA
customer_reviews.text: I have three kitties.. one very smart ginger tabby boy gets very bored, so I bought this in hopes that he would stop tearing up my furniture, swiping stuff off my shelves, pestering the other two brothers and generally causing trouble lol.. The other two sat there and watched him at 1st then got the hang of moving the treats and kibble down to the tray so they could eat it! Even tried to steal some.. but ahh Snuffy is not only smart, but quick. Snuggy & Blizzy learned pretty they had to do it themselves if they wanted any of the goodies. It's entertaining for us all now. :)
customer_reviews.author: DLJ Woodbine

customer_reviews.title: Lots of catertainment in a small (attractive IMO) footprint.
customer_reviews.text: It's awesome. Very stable, easy to fill and clean. The food tree is great for keeping our more intelligent and active kitty entertained. Apologies for the potato pics, my camera is awful.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat doesn't quite get it
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, but my cat doesn't quite use it as intended. Instead of knocking the food to the bottom, she sort of grabs her food in her paw, slides it to the edge, and eats the food directly out of the top. Some food still gets knocked down, but I find the bowl at the bottom doesn't quite catch everything and there's still some spillage. Oh well. It's not perfect, but I'll keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: StrawberryPinch

customer_reviews.title: Was great at first but then the cats grew sentience
customer_reviews.text: So this tower was fabulous when we first got it. One of the cats is a fatty magoo while the other is so opinionated that you have no can'ts to even with her. The uppity one was doing just fine with it but the cow figured out that she just has to put her front paws on the "roof" of it to try and tip it over to get the most food out of it. This would be an excellent food delivery device if the base were MUCH HEAVIER to prevent "smarter" cats from being able to topple it over and inappropriately find treasure.
customer_reviews.author: Chand

customer_reviews.title: Works Wonders!
customer_reviews.text: I have literally tried everything to get my cat to slow doqn when eating, nothing worked, he always puked immediately after eating. After buying this, no more puke! And my fat baby has lost 2 lbs! Ive had him on a diet for almost 2 years and we never saw any progress until, again, this product! Con: im fostering Kittens who figured out that jumping on the top will shake the food out. But once theyre too big to jump on top im sure that wont be a problem!
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Cats hate it, we love it! Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 cats, and like to keep our food dish full all the time, since two are slow eaters and the other two are fat bullies... However, my fatties kept over indulging on food and vomiting... So, we decided to give this a try. To hopefully help them shed a few pounds, and also limit their ability to over eat, without limiting the food being available to the other cats. I will say that while my two fat cats hate this thing, it works great! No vomiting in over a week! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine H.

customer_reviews.title: Food that's hard to catch
customer_reviews.text: My cat is not overweight but she doesn't like food that doesn't present a challenge of some sort. She's not a lazy cat who wants her supper handed over. She wants to hunt it down and capture it. This tower has provided a fun challenge. I fill it with food and she works at it until she gets all the "special" pieces out and eaten. Then, she gets out the rest. If she's feeling really squirrel like, she tosses down a few pieces to the dog. So much better than her old boring dish which had to be tossed through the air whenever she got bored.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie Joy

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous junk with bad return process
customer_reviews.text: Came cracked with little pieces crumpling off. Unsafe, sharp plastic that could kill a cat if they ate it and it tore their stomach. Wouldn't put it past my most recent rescue either, she chews on cardboard. Reached out for a replacement and they wouldn't send it without me sending the item back, which is probably why it's so expensive--we're paying for the cost of everyone else returning broken flimsy plastic. Try a treat ball instead like pet safe. It's durable and costs one third as much
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Cat didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: I adopted an adult cat and she wasn't interested in working for her meals. But this item would be good for training a kitten to eat out of it. It has rubber around the bottom which keeps it grounded on the floor. Not good for rugs. You also need a space large enough to put it if you want the cat to be able to get all around it. I put it against the wall but that's not the best idea as the design of it was made for getting around the whole maze. Don't ruin the packaging when opening in case your cat won't use it.
customer_reviews.author: 2old2care

customer_reviews.title: Shift the middle plate to make the dispense holes even smaller!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost a year ago and thought it was decent- better than my cats scarfing down their meal in less than a minute from a bowl. But even at the smallest setting for the middle dispense area, it didn’t slow them down too much. Just yesterday I noticed the middle plate was askew. When I went to fix it, I realized I could make the hole incredibly small by completely shifting the plate off the 1/2/3 setting. I’ve attached a picture showing what I’m talking about. Now only 1 piece can fit through the slot at a time and it’s dramaticaly increased the amount of time it takes for them to eat!
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Great idea; poor execution.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to have my kitties try this out! It was easy to put together and very sturdy. Unfortunately, each of the openings for cats to stick their paws in had very sharp indents in the plastic. They were so sharp and in every opening - I was concerned about them cutting their pads so I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best of all the slow feeders
customer_reviews.text: I’m really happy with this product. The only thing I wish that had been done differently was that they had made it out of some sort of a silicone so it’s not as noisy. However, I can always tell when my cats are eating because I can hear the little kibbles drop down. This has definitely slowed their eating and there has been no vomiting and they eat less. I tried all the other slow feeders and they all had issues with being messier.
customer_reviews.author: Jane H

customer_reviews.title: Awesome feeder, but loud.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome cat feeder. My cat was eating his dry food way to fast, so this was my solution. It took him a little bit to figure it out, but loves it now! The reason this review isn't a five star, is because the bottom where all the food falls is made out of hard plastic. So when the food falls on it it is super loud! Especially in the middle of the night. I think it would be really nice if it was covered in some silicone or something to buffer that sound. Besides that it's awesome though.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: No more mindless eating
customer_reviews.text: My cat used to just mindless eat whenever we also had breakfast or dinner. Now I put the food in, in the morning or evening and he works for it when he wants a kibble or two. He always played with his food so I thought he might like this. At first he looked at me like "What????? I got to work for it?" But I showed him how a few times and then he was up to it. He was at the weight max for his size before this and is now slightly less after a few months, probably will be goal weight by 1 year (lose 1.5 pounds).
customer_reviews.author: Toran Dax

customer_reviews.title: It works well, but I do have just one little gripe.
customer_reviews.text: The disk that swivels to increase the "difficulty settings" is very easy to turn. I check the feeder once a day and it always goes from the hardest, down to the least hard setting. I clean it once a week and sometimes find food stuck between the difficulty disk and it's base. I don't have much else to say about it other than it does it's job well and it's also very easy to disassemble and clean. Luckily, my cats aren't smart enough to jump on top and shake it like that one reviewer. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the fast eating food obsessed cat!
customer_reviews.text: I had read a doctor who recommended this product being good for cats who eat too fast. My cat loves food and makes all kind of inhaling and gobbling noises while eating. The cat feeding tree gave him a something to do, not quite hunting for his food but he does have to work to eat and it has slowed is eating down. He now chews his kibble and leaves food in the tree which he'll revisit later in the day. This tree was a win win!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cats had nothing to do with it
customer_reviews.text: The product is sturdy and well made. The first one I ordered was damaged and they sent a replacement immediately. I tried for two weeks to get them interested in the product. It was a no go. I have a 13 year old, 3 year old and 6 months, I put in their favorite treats. Nothing. So, for me, it’s got to be a one star. The company is easy to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: L. Caminiti

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I have 3 cats, but only the fattest uses it the most because she eats the most and that's precisely why I bought it, to slow down the food consumption. (or at least try) It comes apart easily to wash it, or transport it. Different settings within the tower to make getting the nibbles out more challenging but I don't think it makes much difference with a smart and determined cat. I would buy it again. I highly recommend it Also bought the Cait water fountain
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Lizz

customer_reviews.title: Fun food dispenser for bored cats
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats. One could not care less about the food tree or the treats inside. The other is a very food motivated boy and frequently gets into mischief at night. I have found loaves of bread ripped open with bites taken out. So I hoped that the food tree stocked with kibble and treats might help keep him occupied and out of trouble at night. It has helped! I dump whatever kibble was in the bowls into the tree along with some treats each night before bed. He still has his nightly escapades and mischief, but it's a less messy lately. I think the entertainment and his sweet tooth attract and distract him.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps kitties interested if food motivated
customer_reviews.text: Sturdily built and easy to assemble and easy to clean Cats can easily access the kibble placed in it. Our cats and one Papillion (yes, our dog likes the mind game toys too) work at it until food is gone. All 3 are highly food motivated so if your pet is not, they may lose interest as did our neighbors cats who pretty much ignored it. A big hit in our house though. All that being said a cat is a cat is a cat-what works for one may not for another. Give it a try-doesn’t work-donate it to a cat shelter.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. I have two fat cats who inhale ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I have two fat cats who inhale would their food and then puke. This product is great because it slows down their eating and keeps from having to puke later on. It also makes them engage during eating time a little more, in that they scoop down individual food bits or knock them out of the tower to the tray. It looks really great too! It's sturdy enough that the don't knock it over. And big enough that two adult cats can eat from it at the same time. My cats obviously hate it, but I love it. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: AWMIATTY

customer_reviews.title: My cat was not impressed
customer_reviews.text: It came in a box with no instructions. But no big deal, it was pretty easy to assemble. Try as I might, my cat would have nothing to do with playing for her food. Apparently it was very much beneath her. I finally ended up giving it to my son and his two cats love it. The box this came in was part of the cat experience. I realized the instructions for assembly were on the box. There was also a template of a hole to cut out so the cat would play in the box. Again, my cat refused to provide my daily dose of amusement. My dog had no issue with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Anne

customer_reviews.title: A great idea...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be the tree of dreams. My cats would stop gorging, throwing up, lose some pounds. Nope. They looked at me like I was trying to kill them and refused to use their little paws at all to work out the food. The Fat Cat laid down and cried. Start you cats on this when they’re young. The elder fickle ones will certainly plan your death if you introduce it mid life. After a solid month of trying, we’re back to the bowls.
customer_reviews.author: dlmill25

customer_reviews.title: Get it already. And don't be tricked by sneaky cats
customer_reviews.text: Love it! There were moments when I thought that my cat couldn't figure out how to get the food out because he was making a lot of noise and rubbing on me. I decided to test it. I dropped a couple of his favorite treats in and he immediately started reaching in and knocking the food around! The food hit the bowl and he sniffed it and went right back up to find the treat... Buy this thing! It'll keep your cat entertained (and you)
customer_reviews.author: Austin Burke

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kitties
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this 5 stars if the top could be secured better to the base but all in all, it's a great product for kitties. The first one to figure this out was my feral cat who seems much smarter than the others. When I found her, she didn't know how to use a kitty box and didn't know how to play. Now, she's the first one to dive right on in to challenges like this and she loves it. I have 4 kitties and all have eventually figured this out but the feral kitty is the one who uses this the most. It's a great product to challenge your kitties.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria B.

customer_reviews.title: This is taller than the images online suggest
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how much taller this item was then what I expected. But once my two cats began to use it, they took to it perfectly. Our younger cat learned quickly how to reach into the slots to move the pellets so they fall into the eating tray. My somewhat older cat can also reach in, but she prefers to allow the younger to move kibble around while she waits to eat from the tray when several kibble bits are dislodged. The best is It certainly does slow down their otherwise ravenous gobbling habits.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Battle of wills!
customer_reviews.text: Getting my cat to use this was a struggle for about a week. She would look at it look at me and lay down by it and wait for me to put food out for her. When I stopped batting the food out of the feeder she was pretty angry wouldn’t get it herself and in retaliation she pooped in my bed! She’s never done anything like that before! The day I was ready to give up and start feeding her out of a bowl again I finally heard a noise and it was my fatso cat FINALLY batting food out the feeder! Stick with it...when they are hungry enough they will get to work!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Strickland

customer_reviews.title: What a great cat toy - even for an older cat!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this toy. I've been purchasing many different types of cat toys over the years, some she enjoyed, some she became bored with quickly. However most get put away after a few months into her cat box of toys. I've been watching her for days play with this toy and I think what keeps her enthralled is when the food drops to the bottom of the tray. Her eyes light up and her whole body quivers, I wonder if the way the food sounds and moves through this toy makes her think it is something alive.
customer_reviews.author: LaLise F

customer_reviews.title: The person I gave it to had to get a second one about 6 months later because her cats loved it and got pretty rough with it
customer_reviews.text: My cats did not have much interest in this so I gave it away. The person I gave it to had to get a second one about 6 months later because her cats loved it and got pretty rough with it. I have another friend who bought one and her cat loved it as well, but soon lost interest. It is probably one of those things you have to take away for a few months like some do with children and their toys.
customer_reviews.author: JinnyM

customer_reviews.title: Much loved
customer_reviews.text: This has been a wonderful addition for our cat. She is obsessed over getting all the food out and it’s fun to watch her figure it out. We’ve had this just over a week now and I look forward to finding another food hunting thing to keep her mind engaged. She spent the whole time purring the first three days of using this. Now it’s enough of our routine that I don’t hear the putts anymore lol. Definitely recommend for indoor only cats that need more mental stimulation.
customer_reviews.author: Deidre Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to feed or feed snacks to out cats
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says. There's a rotatable part on one of the levels that allows you to alter the size of the holes on that level, which has the effect of slowing down how easy it is for the cats to get the food down/out. So depending on how determined/lazy your cat's are (or how quickly you want the fun to be over), you can adjust it somewhat to your liking :)
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Great after the learning curve!
customer_reviews.text: This took our cat a few days to figure out. At first he was decidedly not happy with the change, but now he goes over to it, bats at the food, and gets a snack whenever he wants. He is eating less (which is good since he is a fixed indoor cat) and yet has food around for when he wants it!
customer_reviews.author: Perpetual Preschooler

customer_reviews.title: Cat treat toy
customer_reviews.text: The reason I got this toy was not only to amuse my cat but force her to eat her treats more slowly so she wouldn't eat so fast and barf them up. She has developed the fastest paw in the east. She knows how to cleverly bat the snacks from one level to another. Now I have to find something with more of a challenge. But she loves this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Pat A.

customer_reviews.title: I don't know what cat would use this?
customer_reviews.text: Maddie Mae looked at this and said Are you kidding me? Wouldn't ever even try it. I tried for almost 2 weeks. Nothing zip nada. I bought the white dish with the barriers in it and she only took two days to eat kibble from that. She does also eat wet food, which is what I prefer she eat, but she does love her kibble too. But when she gorges, she throws up, and we needed to slow her down.
customer_reviews.author: doodlebug

customer_reviews.title: My cat didn't like this.
customer_reviews.text: Good enough product. But my kitty could NOT figure this out. I maybe starved him a day and half with food on the upper portion. I tried everything I could think of to get him to stick his paws in there. I shine a laser light in there, dropped his toy mouse, dropped food down for him with my fingers. The last test was just not to feed him until he figured it out. Came home from work and thing wasn't touched and he was very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Makes my obese cat work for her food
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make my 10 year old obese cat have to work for her food. She doesn't put her paw in to get the food, she just rubs against it. She's not one to eat too quickly, but I can see how this would be really good to slow down a fast eater. The wide base is pretty stable, but I still tuck the edge under something so my cat doesn't push it all across the room. I can tell when she's eating because I hear the plastic clink of the food hitting the bottom ring.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Woman

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I am updating my review after recv'ing the comment from Sassy Lady and calling support. My bad.. I thought the two white pieces were supposed to fit together. Once I realized it was the green tower piece that was suppose to connect to the bottom white base... I was on my way and my Kelsey Lynn is loving it!!! Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!! I have a BIG PROBLEM... Explain how I am to put a round bottom base in an oblong top tier base??? I either got part of old version and part of new 2.0 version or I am missing a piece part.
customer_reviews.author: SasZKnitter

customer_reviews.title: Very cute and effective cat toy
customer_reviews.text: Our cat really likes this food tree, and all his other Catit products (the tracks being his favorite). We bought it to stimulate his brain. We put a different brand of kibble in it, instead of treats, because otherwise he'll eat too many treats. He thinks the different brand of kibble is a treat, and will use the tree when he wants a snack. He's very sneaky and will stick his paw in the hole on top and hit the kibble as hard as he can, which is hilarious. The only thing is you have to clean it often since it gets dusty and be vigilant that the kibble just doesn't sit there all the time and get stale obviously.
customer_reviews.author: Yellsy

customer_reviews.title: Defeated by larger cat
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to try to control overeating by our 11.5 lb rescue cat. He is taller with big paws, and is extremely food motivated. He figured out within 1-2 weeks that he could use his size to tip the whole structure and get all the food out. He actually cracked the base by the end of this experiment. This might be fine for smaller cats and kittens, but it was no match for our big cat. Worked well for about 4-7 days... We ended up getting an automatic feeder and it was the best cat purchase I have ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Eh, I’m iffy about it
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with the way this was packaged. The box was damaged and taped up to hold it together. There were also no instructions on how to put it together (or even a picture) so I had to go back to my orders and pull up a picture. My cat hasn’t really used it yet and it doesn’t seem that sturdy. I’ll probably updated this in a couple weeks once I see how my cat reacts to it.
customer_reviews.author: Kate R.

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes it!
customer_reviews.text: A the title says, my cat likes this but I LOVE it. While the food falling to the bottom does make some noise, this is not an issue for me. This is the first feeding system that actually makes my cat SLOW down when he eats; he would eat so fast that he would throw up almost daily. Since getting this, he hasn't thrown up once from eating too fast. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: AHarts

customer_reviews.title: Helped my chonky girl lose weight!
customer_reviews.text: I have one chonky cat and one slim cat, and I've always had trouble getting the chonky one on a diet without the slim one suffering but this tree finally did the trick! I could keep them both on their regular food, and instead of chonky being able to eat out of boredom she has to work for it. Plus, super bonus of it being incredibly entertaining to watch them (they each developed their own tactics). Overall: sturdy, simple, great price. Would be good for slowing fast eaters, stimulating cats, making chonks work for their food, really any cat!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: We have four cats in the household and they love it. Two of the cats took to it ...
customer_reviews.text: We have four cats in the household and they love it. Two of the cats took to it immediately and the other two watched and observed the other cats and then eventually figured it out. They will spend hours trying to get their food. It is a great enrichment toy for the cats!
customer_reviews.author: MMLO

customer_reviews.title: One of my cats loves it
customer_reviews.text: This food tree is great for curious kitties who need a little extra stimulation! It is easy to put together and looks nice enough. One of my two cats is nearly always begging for his next meal. I just cut up those meat stick treats, add them to the tree, and Turbo stays busy for a good while. It’s just difficult enough to keep him engaged, but not so difficult that he gives up. My other cat, however, is not very food-motivated and doesn’t have any interest in this puzzle, so it’s certainly not for every cat. It’s a bit of a gamble and you’ll have to decide whether it will work with your kitty’s personality.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S.

customer_reviews.title: My cats were not amused
customer_reviews.text: Five days into having this product, one of my cats was able to brake off a bottom green plastic part of the tree. Really hope they didn't eat any of the plastic shards, I just adopted these guys, it would really suck if something happens to them. All ready emailed the company let's see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: NSIRick

customer_reviews.title: Fun for this human, slows cats down good
customer_reviews.text: She HATES it, and that's why I love it. My hip cat scarfs food down so quickly and begs for more that I can't fathom how she even does it. Well, now when I feed her dry food she has no choice. And it gives her something to do through the day, and night, and the following day or three. She really, really, hates it. I feed her wet food of course, but dry is for snacking, and the wet food comes in 3 or 4 portions a day.
customer_reviews.author: Ahrel Finnie

customer_reviews.title: Don't spoil your cats for 10 years and think this will work.
customer_reviews.text: My cats looked at this thing like it was a rubic's cube. I tried to two weeks to get them to use it. Not once did they lift a paw to try to save themselves from starvation and I didn't have the heart to wait them out. What did work was me shaking the tree to drop the food which they would reluctantly eat because it wasn't in their bowls 8" away. The 1 star rating should probaly be for my cats, not the tree itself. :)
customer_reviews.author: jeffery b tyson

customer_reviews.title: I thought my cat was smart! Now I'm not so sure
customer_reviews.text: Darn! I thought my cat was smart! Now I'm not so sure! At first he was afraid of this and wouldn't go near it! So I put his wet food in the bottom for a few days and he ate that. Then I tried the kibble. But he doesn't go after the food. He will only eat the kibble from the bottom dish that I push through the holes for him. Otherwise it a quality product. Well made and sturdy. Our vet recommended a puzzle feeder to help our cat lose weight by feeding him less kibble and making him work for his food and use his brain but he hasn't figured this one out after a month! :(
customer_reviews.author: Blueabbey

customer_reviews.title: Great design just not right for my cat
customer_reviews.text: This is well made and this 2.0 version seems to have resolved the complaints people had with the original. The only reason I returned it is my chubby cat was only motivated to use it when I put treats inside, and as much space as this takes up I would want it to become his new feeding dish, not just a kitty treat dispenser. When I put the cat food inside he just stared at me like "why are you starving me?" It is possible if I waited long enough he would eventually have switched over to this slow method of working for his food, though.
customer_reviews.author: B.B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, EZ Assembly, Entertaining puzzle/slow feeder for cat/cats
customer_reviews.text: Great entertainment for me, slow feeder for cats and breaks up monotony for cats. 2 pieces, easy assembly, non skid base won’t slide around. Highly recommended, excellent value and sturdy...great for cat or cats😻
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: No more scarf and barf
customer_reviews.text: I'm newly owned by a rescue cat, who ate fast and vomited his dry food almost as quickly. No more of that! He seems to enjoy the game of knocking the food out of the tree. It forces him to eat slowly enough that he doesn't overeat and it all stays down. It also discourages overeating, because he becomes bored before he has eaten too much. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Reader/writer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this feeder. It took them about a day to figure it out. The rubber gripper on the bottom came out before we used it, and it is a bit wobbly, but we tucked it slightly under the water cooler and it’s working great. I wish the holes on the levels didn’t line up so much, one of my fur butts has already figured out how to cheat it. Still it’s a great feeder and I’m glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Thisismyopinion

customer_reviews.title: like, 4 pieces of kibble every 20 minutes and ...
customer_reviews.text: We have two cats, and one is a snarf-n-barfer. We decided to try this before doing two autofeeders that will dispense, like, 4 pieces of kibble every 20 minutes and cost over $100. It's well-designed and seems solid. The cats are thoroughly unimpressed... maybe a little murdery. We'll give it a go, but we'll be sleeping with one eye open.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely slowed my cat's eating habits
customer_reviews.text: This is great for making meal time more interesting. My cats preferred to scarf down their food in a few seconds. Now they will spend a solid 45 minutes ensuring they eat every last piece out of this gadget. The only annoyance we have is the noise made every time food falls out, which goes on for 45 minutes at a time... But I'm sure I could add something in the dish to quiet that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this!!! My male tabby needs more activity and less food and my little girl in the right has a tiny appetite. They both figured it out in no time! It’s super easy to clean and sturdy! My guy is over 15 lbs and mild mannered, he rubs against it and it stays standing! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M

customer_reviews.title: Good product but mine arrived broken.
customer_reviews.text: The model sent to me is slightly defective. The rubber ring on the bottom was broken and dangling off and I am unable to shove it back in its slot. I’m disappointed as the cats really enjoy eating from this but on tile/wood, they slide the tree around and it makes it difficult for them to actually get food unless they just smack the tree. I have waited on hold twice for 20 minutes trying to reach customer support with no luck. I’ll update this upon getting an intact product.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander B

customer_reviews.title: Slows down feeding and engages problem solving
customer_reviews.text: I adore this thing. Usually our little black cat starts complaining about dry food around 8pm and is a menace if we give her less because of her weight. This thing lets us feed her less without her realizing it, spreads out her eating over hours (she frequently takes breaks), and even plays a little in between. I think she may be proud of herself for figuring it out. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SSkinner

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this because our young cat was getting overweight and we want him to be healthy. With this product it helps him to slow down eating and actually work for what he is getting end it has been fun for him and beneficial for his weight! It took him just a little while to learn how to use it but now that he knows how when he is hungry he goes straight to it and paws out three amount that he wants. Great product! Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley Bessette

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved.
customer_reviews.text: My big, fat kitty figured this out in about an hour. It prevents him from vaccuumin up his food and it is so cute watching him! No, he hasn't turned it over. It took about a week for him to figure out how to paw down all the food. He has lost weight.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted2Prime

customer_reviews.title: As with all cat products, it depends on your ...
customer_reviews.text: As with all cat products, it depends on your cat's preferences! My little creature started using this when we got him at 7 months old & he loves it. In fact, as timid as he is, he actually ran up to me as I was pulling it out of the Amazon box (so bizarre for him!). It took him a while to start understanding it, but it's been about two months and he loves it. I alternate daily between this and the Pet Safe Egg-cersizer and he's all about them :) Other than sleep all day, this it the most stimulation he gets as he's not interested in many of the toys I've gotten for him.
customer_reviews.author: Ned

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price, helps heavy kitties lose weight
customer_reviews.text: Really helped my overweight cat to slow down her eating. She has lost weight and cries much less now that she has to work for her food. She figured it out quickly and seems to enjoy the mental stimulation. It's like a game and meal, all in one. I wish the base were heavier though, weighed perhaps. I just put the corner of heavy furniture on a small part of the base so that my kitty doesnt knock it over. (Because she is big and smart, she figured out that knocking it over is faster than one piece at a time).
customer_reviews.author: Danni

customer_reviews.title: Uneven base. Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My cats got this as a birthday gift. They liked the feeder but the base was uneven due to the small box it was packed in and for that reason I returned it because it wasn’t standing very sturdy and my cats would easily flip it over. I think that manufacturer should look into packaging this feeder into a bigger box. I also think that the feeder itself is huge and it takes too much space into the kitty corner so that was another reason to return it. Hopefully they start manufacturing a smaller version of this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Maya G

product_meta.title: Catit Senses 2.0 Food Tree – Interactive Cat Toy
product_meta.description: Color:greenThe Food Tree Cat Toy is based on the original Catit Food Maze but with several major design upgrades! The Food Tree is difficult to knock over thanks to its new broad stable base, and the top opening was reduced to prevent cheating cats from directly accessing the kibble in the cat bowl. The Senses 2.0 Food Tree acts as a cat slow feeder and is the feeding solution for cats that tend to eat quickly. Cats are required to move the dry kibble or treats from the top to the bottom of the cat puzzle by pawing through the side openings. The kibble ends up in a whisker-stress free cat food bowl, which prevents spillage. The slow feeder cat bowl can be set to various levels of difficulty by rotating the middle disc and adjusting the opening sizes. This cat puzzle feeder is also super easy to disassemble and clean; simply remove the base and top then handwash. We recommend that you handwash this item with natural soap (free of abrasive materials) and water. Catit is focused on creating cat enrichment toys for all cats especially indoor cats. Cat toys for indoor cats should encourage a cat’s natural foraging and hunting behaviors. Our Catit Senses 2.0 line has created a wide variety of cat toys, with this in mind. To keep your cat interested, you need to change their toy set-up often, Catit Senses 2.0 is the only cat toy series that allows you to create new and exciting setups for your cat, quickly and easily! Each toy was designed to activate and stimulate your cat’s unique senses, all in one fresh, green style to match any home interior, no matter the arrangement.
feature_bullets: The Food Tree Cat Toy has a new and improved design with increased stability
Interactive cat toy that stimulates cats to work for their food
Cat Feeder is made of BPA-free materials
Provides 3 difficulty levels to challenge your cat
Easy to disassemble and clean; simply disassemble the food bowl and handwash
For use with dry kibble and treats
Catit Senses 2.0 is a product line developed to activate your cat’s senses; Our cat toys encourage your cat to use sight, smell, taste, touch and hearing to stimulate their natural instincts indoors

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,324 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
